Note the formatting functions are provided 00055 for convenience only, and are NOT considered part of the kernel. */ 00056 #include <stdio.h> 00057 #endif /* configUSE_STATS_FORMATTING_FUNCTIONS == 1 ) */ 00058 00059 #if( configUSE_PREEMPTION == 0 ) 00060 /* If the cooperative scheduler is being used then a yield should not be 00061 performed just because a higher priority task has been woken. */ 00062 #define taskYIELD_IF_USING_PREEMPTION() 00063 #else 00064 #define taskYIELD_IF_USING_PREEMPTION() portYIELD_WITHIN_API() 00065 #endif 00066 00067 /* Values that can be assigned to the ucNotifyState member of the TCB. */ 00068 #define taskNOT_WAITING_NOTIFICATION ( ( uint8_t ) 0 ) 00069 #define taskWAITING_NOTIFICATION ( ( uint8_t ) 1 ) 00070 #define taskNOTIFICATION_RECEIVED ( ( uint8_t ) 2 ) 00071 00072 /* 00073 * The value used to fill the stack of a task when the task is created. If none of the following are 00085 set then don't fill the stack so there is no unnecessary dependency on memset. */ 00086 #if( ( configCHECK_FOR_STACK_OVERFLOW > 1 ) || ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) || ( INCLUDE_uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark == 1 ) || ( INCLUDE_uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark2 == 1 ) ) 00087 #define tskSET_NEW_STACKS_TO_KNOWN_VALUE 1 00088 #else 00089 #define tskSET_NEW_STACKS_TO_KNOWN_VALUE 0 00090 #endif 00091 00092 /* 00093 * Macros used by vListTask to indicate which state a task is in. 00094 */ 00095 #define tskRUNNING_CHAR ( 'X' ) 00096 #define tskBLOCKED_CHAR ( 'B' ) 00097 #define tskREADY_CHAR ( 'R' ) 00098 #define tskDELETED_CHAR ( 'D' ) 00099 #define tskSUSPENDED_CHAR ( 'S' ) 00100 00101 /* 00102 * Some kernel aware debuggers require the data the debugger needs access to be 00103 * global, rather than file scope. 00104 */ 00105 #ifdef portREMOVE_STATIC_QUALIFIER 00106 #define static 00107 #endif 00108 00109 /* The name allocated to the Idle task. This can be overridden by defining 00110 configIDLE_TASK_NAME in FreeRTOSConfig.h. */ 00111 #ifndef configIDLE_TASK_NAME 00112 #define configIDLE_TASK_NAME "IDLE" 00113 #endif 00114 00115 #if ( configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION == 0 ) 00116 00117 /* If configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION is 0 then task selection is 00118 performed in a generic way that is not optimised to any particular 00119 microcontroller architecture. */ 00120 00121 /* uxTopReadyPriority holds the priority of the highest priority ready 00122 state task. */ 00123 #define taskRECORD_READY_PRIORITY( uxPriority ) \ 00124 { \ 00125 if( ( uxPriority ) > uxTopReadyPriority ) \ 00126 { \ 00127 uxTopReadyPriority = ( uxPriority ); \ 00128 } \ 00129 } /* taskRECORD_READY_PRIORITY */ 00130 00131 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00132 00133 #define taskSELECT_HIGHEST_PRIORITY_TASK() \ 00134 { \ 00135 UBaseType_t uxTopPriority = uxTopReadyPriority; \ 00136 \ 00137 /* Find the highest priority queue that contains ready tasks. */ \ 00138 while( listLIST_IS_EMPTY( &( pxReadyTasksLists[ uxTopPriority ] ) ) ) \ 00139 { \ 00140 configASSERT( uxTopPriority ); \ 00141 --uxTopPriority; \ 00142 } \ 00143 \ 00144 /* listGET_OWNER_OF_NEXT_ENTRY indexes through the list, so the tasks of \ 00145 the same priority get an equal share of the processor time. */ \ 00146 listGET_OWNER_OF_NEXT_ENTRY( pxCurrentTCB, &( pxReadyTasksLists[ uxTopPriority ] ) ); \ 00147 uxTopReadyPriority = uxTopPriority; \ 00148 } /* taskSELECT_HIGHEST_PRIORITY_TASK */ 00149 00150 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00151 00152 /* Define away taskRESET_READY_PRIORITY() and portRESET_READY_PRIORITY() as 00153 they are only required when a port optimised method of task selection is 00154 being used. */ 00155 #define taskRESET_READY_PRIORITY( uxPriority ) 00156 #define portRESET_READY_PRIORITY( uxPriority, uxTopReadyPriority ) 00157 00158 #else /* configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION */ 00159 00160 /* If configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION is 1 then task selection is 00161 performed in a way that is tailored to the particular microcontroller 00162 architecture being used. */ 00163 00164 /* A port optimised version is provided. Call the port defined macros. */ 00165 #define taskRECORD_READY_PRIORITY( uxPriority ) portRECORD_READY_PRIORITY( uxPriority, uxTopReadyPriority ) 00166 00167 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00168 00169 #define taskSELECT_HIGHEST_PRIORITY_TASK() \ 00170 { \ 00171 UBaseType_t uxTopPriority; \ 00172 \ 00173 /* Find the highest priority list that contains ready tasks. */ \ 00174 portGET_HIGHEST_PRIORITY( uxTopPriority, uxTopReadyPriority ); \ 00175 configASSERT( listCURRENT_LIST_LENGTH( &( pxReadyTasksLists[ uxTopPriority ] ) ) > 0 ); \ 00176 listGET_OWNER_OF_NEXT_ENTRY( pxCurrentTCB, &( pxReadyTasksLists[ uxTopPriority ] ) ); \ 00177 } /* taskSELECT_HIGHEST_PRIORITY_TASK() */ 00178 00179 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00180 00181 /* A port optimised version is provided, call it only if the TCB being reset 00182 is being referenced from a ready list. If it is referenced from a delayed 00183 or suspended list then it won't be in a ready list. */ 00184 #define taskRESET_READY_PRIORITY( uxPriority ) \ 00185 { \ 00186 if( listCURRENT_LIST_LENGTH( &( pxReadyTasksLists[ ( uxPriority ) ] ) ) == ( UBaseType_t ) 0 ) \ 00187 { \ 00188 portRESET_READY_PRIORITY( ( uxPriority ), ( uxTopReadyPriority ) ); \ 00189 } \ 00190 } 00191 00192 #endif /* configUSE_PORT_OPTIMISED_TASK_SELECTION */ 00193 00194 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00195 00196 /* pxDelayedTaskList and pxOverflowDelayedTaskList are switched when the tick 00197 count overflows. */ 00198 #define taskSWITCH_DELAYED_LISTS() \ 00199 { \ 00200 List_t *pxTemp; \ 00201 \ 00202 /* The delayed tasks list should be empty when the lists are switched. */ \ 00203 configASSERT( ( listLIST_IS_EMPTY( pxDelayedTaskList ) ) ); \ 00204 \ 00205 pxTemp = pxDelayedTaskList; \ 00206 pxDelayedTaskList = pxOverflowDelayedTaskList; \ 00207 pxOverflowDelayedTaskList = pxTemp; \ 00208 xNumOfOverflows++; \ 00209 prvResetNextTaskUnblockTime(); \ 00210 } 00211 00212 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00213 00214 /* 00215 * Place the task represented by pxTCB into the appropriate ready list for 00216 * the task. It is inserted at the end of the list. 00217 */ 00218 #define prvAddTaskToReadyList( pxTCB ) \ 00219 traceMOVED_TASK_TO_READY_STATE( pxTCB ); \ 00220 taskRECORD_READY_PRIORITY( ( pxTCB )->uxPriority ); \ 00221 vListInsertEnd( &( pxReadyTasksLists[ ( pxTCB )->uxPriority ] ), &( ( pxTCB )->xStateListItem ) ); \ 00222 tracePOST_MOVED_TASK_TO_READY_STATE( pxTCB ) 00223 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00224 00225 /* 00226 * Several functions take an TaskHandle_t parameter that can optionally be NULL, 00227 * where NULL is used to indicate that the handle of the currently executing 00228 * task should be used in place of the parameter. This macro simply checks to 00229 * see if the parameter is NULL and returns a pointer to the appropriate TCB. 00230 */ 00231 #define prvGetTCBFromHandle( pxHandle ) ( ( ( pxHandle ) == NULL ) ? pxCurrentTCB : ( pxHandle ) ) 00232 00233 /* The item value of the event list item is normally used to hold the priority 00234 of the task to which it belongs (coded to allow it to be held in reverse 00235 priority order). However, it is occasionally borrowed for other purposes. It 00236 is important its value is not updated due to a task priority change while it is 00237 being used for another purpose. The following bit definition is used to inform 00238 the scheduler that the value should not be changed - in which case it is the 00239 responsibility of whichever module is using the value to ensure it gets set back 00240 to its original value when it is released. */ 00241 #if( configUSE_16_BIT_TICKS == 1 ) 00242 #define taskEVENT_LIST_ITEM_VALUE_IN_USE 0x8000U 00243 #else 00244 #define taskEVENT_LIST_ITEM_VALUE_IN_USE 0x80000000UL 00245 #endif 00246 00247 /* 00248 * Task control block. A task control block (TCB) is allocated for each task, 00249 * and stores task state information, including a pointer to the task's context 00250 * (the task's run time environment, including register values) 00251 */ 00252 typedef struct tskTaskControlBlock /* The old naming convention is used to prevent breaking kernel aware debuggers. */ 00253 { 00254 volatile StackType_t *pxTopOfStack; /*< Points to the location of the last item placed on the tasks stack. THIS MUST BE THE FIRST MEMBER OF THE TCB STRUCT. */ 00255 00256 #if ( portUSING_MPU_WRAPPERS == 1 ) 00257 xMPU_SETTINGS xMPUSettings; /*< The MPU settings are defined as part of the port layer. THIS MUST BE THE SECOND MEMBER OF THE TCB STRUCT. */ 00258 #endif 00259 00260 ListItem_t xStateListItem; /*< The list that the state list item of a task is reference from denotes the state of that task (Ready, Blocked, Suspended ). */ 00261 ListItem_t xEventListItem; /*< Used to reference a task from an event list. */ 00262 UBaseType_t uxPriority; /*< The priority of the task. 0 is the lowest priority. */ 00263 StackType_t *pxStack; /*< Points to the start of the stack. */ 00264 char pcTaskName[ configMAX_TASK_NAME_LEN ];/*< Descriptive name given to the task when created. Facilitates debugging only. */ /*lint !e971 Unqualified char types are allowed for strings and single characters only. */ 00265 00266 #if ( ( portSTACK_GROWTH > 0 ) || ( configRECORD_STACK_HIGH_ADDRESS == 1 ) ) 00267 StackType_t *pxEndOfStack; /*< Points to the highest valid address for the stack. */ 00268 #endif 00269 00270 #if ( portCRITICAL_NESTING_IN_TCB == 1 ) 00271 UBaseType_t uxCriticalNesting; /*< Holds the critical section nesting depth for ports that do not maintain their own count in the port layer. */ 00272 #endif 00273 00274 #if ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 00275 UBaseType_t uxTCBNumber; /*< Stores a number that increments each time a TCB is created. It allows debuggers to determine when a task has been deleted and then recreated. */ 00276 UBaseType_t uxTaskNumber; /*< Stores a number specifically for use by third party trace code. */ 00277 #endif 00278 00279 #if ( configUSE_MUTEXES == 1 ) 00280 UBaseType_t uxBasePriority; /*< The priority last assigned to the task - used by the priority inheritance mechanism. */ 00281 UBaseType_t uxMutexesHeld; 00282 #endif 00283 00284 #if ( configUSE_APPLICATION_TASK_TAG == 1 ) 00285 TaskHookFunction_t pxTaskTag; 00286 #endif 00287 00288 #if( configNUM_THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_POINTERS > 0 ) 00289 void *pvThreadLocalStoragePointers[ configNUM_THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_POINTERS ]; 00290 #endif 00291 00292 #if( configGENERATE_RUN_TIME_STATS == 1 ) 00293 uint32_t ulRunTimeCounter; /*< Stores the amount of time the task has spent in the Running state. */ 00294 #endif 00295 00296 #if ( configUSE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT == 1 ) 00297 /* Allocate a Newlib reent structure that is specific to this task. 00298 Note Newlib support has been included by popular demand, but is not 00299 used by the FreeRTOS maintainers themselves. The equivalent prototype for this function is: 00446 * 00447 * void prvIdleTask( void *pvParameters ); 00448 * 00449 */ 00450 static portTASK_FUNCTION_PROTO( prvIdleTask, pvParameters ); 00451 00452 /* 00453 * Utility to free all memory allocated by the scheduler to hold a TCB, 00454 * including the stack pointed to by the TCB. 00455 * 00456 * This does not free memory allocated by the task itself (i.e. memory 00457 * allocated by calls to pvPortMalloc from within the tasks application code). 00458 */ 00459 #if ( INCLUDE_vTaskDelete == 1 ) 00460 00461 static void prvDeleteTCB( TCB_t *pxTCB ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00462 00463 #endif 00464 00465 /* 00466 * Used only by the idle task. Add the task to 00474 * either the current or the overflow delayed task list. 00475 */ 00476 static void prvAddCurrentTaskToDelayedList( TickType_t xTicksToWait, const BaseType_t xCanBlockIndefinitely ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00489 00490 #endif 00491 00492 /* 00493 * Searches pxList for a task with name pcNameToQuery - returning a handle to 00494 * the task if it is found, or NULL if the task is not found. 00495 */ 00496 #if ( INCLUDE_xTaskGetHandle == 1 ) 00497 00498 static TCB_t *prvSearchForNameWithinSingleList( List_t *pxList, const char pcNameToQuery[] ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION; 00499 00500 #endif 00501 00502 /* 00503 * When a task is created, the stack of the task is filled with a known value. 00504 * This function determines the 'high water mark' of the task stack by 00505 * determining how much of the stack remains at the original preset value. 00506 */ 00507 #if ( ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) || ( INCLUDE_uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark == 1 ) || ( INCLUDE_uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark2 == 1 ) ) 00508 00509 static configSTACK_DEPTH_TYPE prvTaskCheckFreeStackSpace( const uint8_t * pucStackByte ) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION;
